title: Shopkeeper fights off 'armed' thugs who threatened to 'cut his face off'
text:

A shopkeeper defiantly stood up to two thugs who tried to raid his convenience store and threatened to "cut his face off."

CCTV footage shows Peter Waller fighting off the crooks, with hoods up and over their faces, after they entered One Stop in Middlesbrough.

The 63-year-old, who has run the shop for 30 years, had just opened up when the pair came in at 5.20am on Tuesday, reports Teesside Live .

As they barged into the cashier area, Mr Waller is seen on video punching one of the men before pushing the other to the floor.

(Image: Teesside Live/Katie Lunn)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

And while the brave shopkeeper wrestled with one of them, the other man tried to get access to the tills, without success.

Despite the violence and threats, he refused to back down and the pair eventually fled with a couple of cigarettes.

Mr Waller later told of how one of the thieves was carrying something up his sleeve and threatened to "cut my f***ing face off".

(Image: Teesside Live/Katie Lunn)

The shopkeeper was treated in hospital for neck and shoulder damage, but refused to let the incident disrupt his business and was back at work the next day.

Cleveland Police, who is investigating the robbery, is asking anyone who witnessed the incident, or has any information, to contact DC Jay Murfitt on the non-emergency number 101, quoting the reference number 177599.
description: Peter Waller, who runs a One Stop shop in Middlesbrough, refused to back down when two robbers barged into his shop
